content.description:
A student weighs a sample of a group 2 metal, <math alttext="M " overflow="scroll"><mtext>M</mtext></math>, and adds it to excess <math alttext="H C l, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCl</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> to react as represented in the equation.

<math alttext="M, solid, plus 2 H C l, aqueous, reacts to produce M C l 2, aqueous, plus H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>M</mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>s</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo> </mo> <mi>HCl</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mtext>MCl</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math> 

The student measures the volume of <math alttext="H 2, gas " overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> produced by collecting the gas over water at <math alttext="1.00 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.00</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>atm</mtext></math> and <math alttext="298 kelvins " overflow="scroll"><mn>298</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>K</mtext></math>, and uses the volume to calculate the moles of <math alttext="H 2, gas " overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>.
content.question: Which of the following questions is most likely to be answered as a result of the experiment?

choices.label: What is the value of <math alttext="delta H naught sub reaction" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msubsup><mi>H</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow><mo>∘</mo></msubsup></math>?
What is the density of metal <math alttext="M " overflow="scroll"><mtext>M</mtext></math>?
What is the molar mass of metal <math alttext="M " overflow="scroll"><mtext>M</mtext></math>?
What is the value of the specific heat of metal <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M</mtext></math>?

content.answer: What is the molar mass of metal <math alttext="M " overflow="scroll"><mtext>M</mtext></math>?

skill.text: 2.A: Identify a testable scientific question based on an observation, data, or a model.
